intro: Souroubea guianensis var. corallina, commonly known as the coral sponge tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its unique, sponge-like bark that gives it its common name. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and prefers well-drained soil. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture, adding to its aesthetic appeal.
